content:
• Monday, June 24, 2013
  • MITL

    More on Mitel Networks (NASDAQ:MITL): FQ4 results come in ahead of Street consensus. Net...

    More on Mitel Networks (NASDAQ:MITL): FQ4 results come in ahead of Street consensus. Net earnings fell 84% Y/Y as deferred income boosted year-earlier results. Gross margin narrowed to 84.7% from 87.7%. Looking ahead, the company sees current-quarter revenue between $140M and $146M. Analysts are projecting $146M in revenue. Shares +8.7% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:29 PM
  • CALL

    MagicJack (NASDAQ:CALL) launches a new version of its magicJack Plus VoIP adapter the company...

    MagicJack (NASDAQ:CALL) launches a new version of its magicJack Plus VoIP adapter the company says offers superior voice quality and more processing power/memory. Six months of free service are provided, after which an annual renewal costs $30. Like the current model, it sells for $50. Shares +1% AH after falling 5.9% in regular trading. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 6:38 PM | 1 Comment
  • SONC

    More on Sonic (NASDAQ:SONC): FQ3 comes in mixed with an in-line per share number but missing...

    More on Sonic (NASDAQ:SONC): FQ3 comes in mixed with an in-line per share number but missing slightly on the revenue side. Net earnings rose 2.7% as the drive-in restaurant chain posted lower costs and expenses which offset a decline in drive-in sales. Shares -2.3% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:06 PM
  • MITL

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: MITL +9%. PDLI +5%. EBIX +4%. VWO +4%. FSS +2%....

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: MITL +9%. PDLI +5%. EBIX +4%. VWO +4%. FSS +2%.
    After-hours top losers: ELP -7%. AVP -4%. BFAM -3%. EXPR -3%. DEI -3%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:30 PM
  • DRWI

    DragonWave (DRWI +6.1%) closes with a strong gain after announcing Cisco is supporting the use...

    DragonWave (DRWI +6.1%) closes with a strong gain after announcing Cisco is supporting the use of DragonWave's Avenue mobile backhaul systems for use with its ASR 901 mobile aggregation router for use in small cell deployments. Small cell base station deployments in densely-populated settings is expected to grow rapidly in the next few years.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:57 PM
  • MITK

    Mitek Systems (NASDAQ:MITK) falls 11.1% AH after announcing a proposed public offering. (PR)

    Mitek Systems (NASDAQ:MITK) falls 11.1% AH after announcing a proposed public offering. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:35 PM | 1 Comment
  • NAV

    Navistar (NYSE:NAV) says its CFO, Andrew A.J. Cederoth, will be leaving at the end of the month...

    Navistar (NYSE:NAV) says its CFO, Andrew A.J. Cederoth, will be leaving at the end of the month as part of a planned transition. Mr. Cederoth has served as the company's CFO since September 2009. Current senior VP and treasurer James Moran will oversee financial operations and functions on an interim basis, while the company finalizes its search for a new CFO from outside the company. Shares -4.7% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:26 PM
  • BBEPQ

    Investors turn an initial thumbs-down to BreitBurn Energy Partners' (BBEP -2.8%) purchase of...

    Investors turn an initial thumbs-down to BreitBurn Energy Partners' (BBEP -2.8%) purchase of $860M of assets in Oklahoma from Whiting Petroleum (WLL -1.2%) to be funded with debt. Oil from the fields will sell for $8/bbl less than benchmark WTI, and lifting costs will run at $18/bbl. BBEP says the deal will increase cash available to pay unitholders and support its target to boost the payout by 5%/year.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:18 PM
  • JNJ

    Johnson & Johnson's (JNJ +2.5%) subsidiary Cordis says European regulators and the FDA have...

    Johnson & Johnson's (JNJ +2.5%) subsidiary Cordis says European regulators and the FDA have approved additional sizes for the company's Sleek OTW platform, an ultra-low profile percutaneous transluminal angioplasty dilatation catheter. The device is a highly deliverable balloon catheter designed to treat patients undergoing peripheral angioplasty procedures below the knee.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:12 PM
  • HALO

    Talk about bucking the trend: Halozyme Therapeutics (HALO +10.7%) breaks into positive territory...

    Talk about bucking the trend: Halozyme Therapeutics (HALO +10.7%) breaks into positive territory and then promptly soars double-digits on more than twice the average ten-day volume.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:54 PM
  • FCX

    The ugliness could just be getting started in the big mining names, Chess n Wine says in...

    The ugliness could just be getting started in the big mining names, Chess n Wine says in studying Freeport McMoRan's (FCX -3.8%) chart, where "unless bulls immediately improve the stock, [there's] room to drop below major, multi-year support with not much below until the 2008 crash lows." Charts for BHP (BHP -1.3%), Caterpillar (CAT -1.3%) and Rio Tinto (RIO -1.9%) all face similar setups, the blog says.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:45 PM | 3 Comments
  • IBIO

    iBio (IBIO +4%) says the government of Brazil will invest $170M in the construction of the first...

    iBio (IBIO +4%) says the government of Brazil will invest $170M in the construction of the first national factory of organic products made from plant cell technology. IBIO and its partner GE Healthcare (NYSE:GE), had earler signed a contract to design a new plant-based multipurpose manufacturing facility for Bio-Manguinhos/Fiocruz in Brazil. The factory will be the first plant-based biotechnological facility registered with the FDA and the National Agency for Sanitary Surveillance, worldwide.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:45 PM
  • THC

    "This marks a turning point for the company in which we'll be more aggressive in acquisitions,"...

    "This marks a turning point for the company in which we'll be more aggressive in acquisitions," Tenet Healthcare (THC +5.2%) CEO Trevor Fetter tells CNBC, after agreeing to acquire Vanguard Health for $21/share. Fetter goes on to say that he looks forward to an "expanded acquisition pipeline in the acute care business."
     
     
     
     
    | 2:40 PM
  • ULTA

    Jefferies raises its price target on Ulta Salon (ULTA +3.2%) to $110 from $100 citing a...

    Jefferies raises its price target on Ulta Salon (ULTA +3.2%) to $110 from $100 citing a favorable risk/ reward profile. Analyst Randal Konik says a hosted HQ tour on Friday left him convinced that the company "is in a very favorable position." (Also: ULTA names new CEO; Sterne Agee likes ULTA)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:21 PM
  • CLBS

    Neostem (NBS +5.7%) gets a boost from an upgrade at Aegis Capital with a Buy rating and a $2.50...

    Neostem (NBS +5.7%) gets a boost from an upgrade at Aegis Capital with a Buy rating and a $2.50 price target. Aegis says NBS represents a unique participant in the stem cell sector, given the fact that it has four different technology platforms and a solid lead product candidate, AMR-001, which is a stem cell-based therapeutic for cardiovascular disease with tremendous potential. The drug is currently in a proof-of-concept Phase 2 trial that is slated to report data early next year, and positive results could land it a partnership with Baxter (NYSE:BAX).

     
     
     
     
    | 2:20 PM | 2 Comments
  • EDMC

    Shares of Education Management Corporation (EDMC -11.4%) slide double-digits, bringing two-day...

    Shares of Education Management Corporation (EDMC -11.4%) slide double-digits, bringing two-day losses to more than 20% as the for-profits add to Friday's losses amid the broad market turmoil. Rundown: APOL -0.94, COCO -0.93%, STRA -1.86%, LOPE -0.86%, LINC -5.15% (previous), ESI-OLD -4.97%.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:05 PM | 2 Comments
  • BB

    BlackBerry (BBRY +2.8%) rallies on a down day after several analysts forecast the company will...

    BlackBerry (BBRY +2.8%) rallies on a down day after several analysts forecast the company will top an FQ1 EPS consensus of $0.06 when it reports on Friday, but reiterate neutral ratings. UBS (Neutral and $0.10 forecast) expects FQ1 BB10 shipments to total 3.7M with the help of channel fill (echoes of BMO). William Blair (Market Perform and $0.13) forecasts 3.3M BB10 sales thanks to "pent-up demand" from BlackBerry's base, but also says "checks suggest BlackBerry remains an afterthought in most stores." Goldman (Neutral and $0.16) forecasts 3.5M BB10 sales thanks to "a good start" for the Q10, but is "well below consensus" starting in FQ3.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:57 PM | 16 Comments
  • IONS

    Isis Pharmaceuticals (ISIS +24.1%) soars after results from a Phase 2 trial of ISIS-APOCIIIRx...

    Isis Pharmaceuticals (ISIS +24.1%) soars after results from a Phase 2 trial of ISIS-APOCIIIRx impress. Needham's Chad Messer likes the news, calling "improved measures of glucose control and insulin sensitivity in a diabetic population" particularly important and reiterating the shares at Buy (price target raised to $29 from $27). Meanwhile, BMO's Jim Birchenough says the results are "stunning" and maintains a $31 price target and an Outperform rating.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:39 PM | 1 Comment
  • CRUS

    Apple suppliers haven't responded well to Jefferies' note about high iPhone channel inventories,...

    Apple suppliers haven't responded well to Jefferies' note about high iPhone channel inventories, build order cuts, app processor production cuts, and memory reallocations. CRUS -4.4%. OVTI -5.7%. SWKS -3.5%. RFMD -3.5%. STM -3.9%. NTE -4.6%. NXPI -5.4%. InvenSense (INVN -7.4%), which isn't yet an Apple supplier but is expected to be one soon, is also off sharply.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:37 PM | 6 Comments
  • YY

    Chinese Internet and solar stocks fall hard after growing banking sector liquidity worries...

    Chinese Internet and solar stocks fall hard after growing banking sector liquidity worries contribute to a 5.3% drop for the Shanghai Composite. Notable decliners: YY -13%. DANG -9%. GA -8.9%. PWRD -7.2%. YOKU -6.6%. SOHU -5.8%. NQ -5.6%. CSIQ -8.4%. TSL -8.3%. LDK -7.5%. JKS -6.9%. JASO -6.9%. DQ -7.1%. SOL -6.7%. Meanwhile, Bloomberg observes many Chinese solar firms, including Trina, JinkoSolar, and Canadian Solar, are moving production overseas to counter EU import tariffs.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:23 PM
  • SSKN

    MELA Sciences (MELA +5.6%) gets a pop after Interim CEO Robert Coradini disclosed the purchase...

    MELA Sciences (MELA +5.6%) gets a pop after Interim CEO Robert Coradini disclosed the purchase of 50K shares today at an average price of $0.7198, bringing his stake to 71,457 shares. Director Kathryn Swintek also purchased 17K shares at $0.729.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:19 PM
  • TATT

    TAT Technologies (TATT +7.8%) says its Receiver has informed the company that the wining...

    TAT Technologies (TATT +7.8%) says its Receiver has informed the company that the wining proposal to acquire its tendered shares was received from private equity investor FIMI Opportunity V for $7.30 per share. FIMI will purchase 3,845,908 shares held by TATT and 886,443 shares held by controlling shareholder KMN Industries, which represent 43.71% and 10.07% of the Company's outstanding share capital, respectively.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:11 PM
  • STEC

    Midday top 10 gainers: STEC +87%. VHS +69%. KEYN +47%. ISIS +20%. MBND +13%. MLNK +10%. NMRX...

    Midday top 10 gainers: STEC +87%. VHS +69%. KEYN +47%. ISIS +20%. MBND +13%. MLNK +10%. NMRX +8%. TATT +8%. OESX +8%. REV +7%.
    Midday top 10 Losers: AUMN -20%. SZYM -18%. CMGE -17%. HYGS -17%. CBAK-OLD -16%. YY -15%. WLT -15%. APAGF -15%. NOAH -14%. JRCC -13%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM
  • AAPL

    Apple (AAPL -3.3%) roundup: 1) Shares are near $400 thanks to Peter Misek's note and an equity...

    Apple (AAPL -3.3%) roundup: 1) Shares are near $400 thanks to Peter Misek's note and an equity selloff. On top of reporting of high inventories (a reason for Wal-Mart's promotion?), Misek says checks indicate Apple's wafer starts at a Samsung fab used for app processor production "have likely been cut." 2) Global Equities claims "recruiters are seeing more and more employees from Apple applying for jobs" at other tech companies (previous). 3) TSMC (NYSE:TSM) has scored a 3-year app processor deal with Apple, says Digitimes. Volume production of Apple's A8 CPU, said to use TSMC's next-gen 20nm process, will reportedly start after December. 4) The Supreme Court has rejected an appeal from Mirror Worlds to review an overturned $625.5M infringement ruling against Apple.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:42 PM | 18 Comments
  • HLF

    Shares of Herbalife (HLF -5.4%) are taking a hit today on reports that its controversial...

    Shares of Herbalife (HLF -5.4%) are taking a hit today on reports that its controversial Chairman's Club distributor Shawn Dahl has resigned and is taking some other reps with him. Dahl, along with some of his sales recruits are jumping to Nutrie, a competing diet protein shake marketer.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:41 PM | 16 Comments
  • TVIAQ

    Solazyme (SZYM -17.8%) sinks following news it will dissolve its joint venture with Roquette...

    Solazyme (SZYM -17.8%) sinks following news it will dissolve its joint venture with Roquette Frères after failing to agree on a commercial strategy and timeline for the manufacturing and marketing of the venture's products. SZYM says it will accelerate commercialization of its own suite of microalgal food ingredients. At least two firms say today's selloff on the news is an overreaction.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:37 PM | 5 Comments
  • ITW

    Illinois Tool Works (ITW -1.3%) slips on a downgrade to Sell on valuation. Goldman says ITW's...

    Illinois Tool Works (ITW -1.3%) slips on a downgrade to Sell on valuation. Goldman says ITW's multiple is rich and earnings upside is unlikely in 2013/2014 given slow growth across its portfolio.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:20 PM
  • WPZ

    Williams Partners (WPZ -3.7%; WMB -2.6%) says it has begun assessing damage caused by the...

    Williams Partners (WPZ -3.7%; WMB -2.6%) says it has begun assessing damage caused by the explosion and fire that occurred at its Geismar, La., olefins plant earlier this month, although the gas pipeline owner says neither the full extent of the damage nor the time needed to make repairs is known. The plant remains shut down and the expansion work is temporarily suspended.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:15 PM
  • GGG

    Graco (GGG -1.7%) shrugs off an upgrade at Goldman Sachs to trade lower today, as the firm...

    Graco (GGG -1.7%) shrugs off an upgrade at Goldman Sachs to trade lower today, as the firm raises the shares from Sell to Neutral and raises its price target from $60 to $68. The firm notes GGG's increasing ability to expand margins due to improved cost controls and better mix/volume leverage in Contractor.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:01 PM
  • ROVI

    Rovi (ROVI -4.8%) falls hard following a downgrade to Underperform from Pac Crest: the firm...

    Rovi (ROVI -4.8%) falls hard following a downgrade to Underperform from Pac Crest: the firm thinks recent settlements and adverse legal rulings damage the value of the company's IP. Shares still +46% YTD following a dismal 2012.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:00 PM
  • EGY

    Vaalco Energy (EGY -5.9%) says it abandoned an exploration appraisal well drilled and logged to...

    Vaalco Energy (EGY -5.9%) says it abandoned an exploration appraisal well drilled and logged to evaluate an untested fault block in the Ebouri field offshore Gabon after encountering water. EGY and its partners are evaluating the availability of drilling rigs for additional exploration wells offshore Gabon once the current multi-well drilling program is completed.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:42 AM
  • DE

    Deere (DE -2.3%) takes a hit as JPMorgan cuts the shares to Underweight and lowered its price...

    Deere (DE -2.3%) takes a hit as JPMorgan cuts the shares to Underweight and lowered its price target from $91 to $76. The firm thinks that farm cash receipts and incomes have passed their peak due to an increase in crop growth that will drive prices lower and higher land prices which have pushed rent costs up. This means profit per acre is likely to fall significantly from here. Additionally, tax incentives are due to expire at year-end and equipment costs are about to rise with higher emissions standards.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:37 AM
  • OBE

    Penn West Petroleum (PWE -5.3%) says it identified a failure in a produced water pipeline in its...

    Penn West Petroleum (PWE -5.3%) says it identified a failure in a produced water pipeline in its Slave field in Alberta, which was immediately shut-in and isolated. PWE says there were no injuries and the spill of 400-600 cubic meters doesn’t pose a hazard to any waterways.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:26 AM
  • AGN

    The negative commentary isn't letting up for Allergan (AGN -9.2%) as the shares are under...

    The negative commentary isn't letting up for Allergan (AGN -9.2%) as the shares are under significant pressure following Friday's FDA letter on a non-clinical approval pathway for generic Restasis and subsequent chatter out of analysts at Deutsche and Leerink. Piper's David Amsellem joins the fray saying that while proving bioequivalence "will not necessarily be simple … there are a number of generic companies with the sophistication to at least pursue the product, and certainly a path forward without clinical trials makes the opportunity that more attractive." Price target lowered to $79 from $90.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:16 AM | 1 Comment
  • WOR

    Worthington Industries (WOR -4.2%) said Friday it will close its BernzOmatic hand-torch...

    Worthington Industries (WOR -4.2%) said Friday it will close its BernzOmatic hand-torch manufacturing operation in New York and consolidate it with an existing facility in Wisconsin to cut expenses and maximize available production capacity. WOR had acquired the operation in 2011 from a subsidiary of Newell Rubbermaid; the facility originally opened in 1969.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:58 AM
  • CUB

    Cubic (CUB -2.3%) slips this morning as Credit Suisse initiates the shares at Neutral with a...

    Cubic (CUB -2.3%) slips this morning as Credit Suisse initiates the shares at Neutral with a price target of $53. The firm notes that while its growth story is remains attractive, the company has 61% revenue exposure to U.S.-focused defense markets. Given budgetary pressures and flat expectations for DoD spending, it sees little top-line upside in these businesses.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:43 AM
  • ATW

    Atwood Oceanics (ATW -2.9%) enters into a turnkey construction contract with Daewoo Shipbuilding...

    Atwood Oceanics (ATW -2.9%) enters into a turnkey construction contract with Daewoo Shipbuilding for a fourth ultra-deepwater drillship in a deal worth ~$635M for the South Korean yard. Upon delivery, the Atwood Archer will become the 17th mobile offshore drilling unit owned by ATW.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:41 AM
  • KTOS

    Kratos Defense & Security Solutions' (KTOS -2.5%) slips depite the earlier announcement that...

    Kratos Defense & Security Solutions' (KTOS -2.5%) slips depite the earlier announcement that its Public Safety & Security Solutions Division had inked around $4M in new contract awards for the deployment of specialized security systems at certain mass transit, port authority and transportation related sites. Under the agreement, KTOS will deploy video surveillance, wireless communications, access control and other security related elements designed for the protection of the system's overall infrastructure.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:30 AM
  • REPYY

    Repsol (OTCQX:REPYY) has received a non-cash compensation offer worth $5B from Argentina over...

    Repsol (OTCQX:REPYY) has received a non-cash compensation offer worth $5B from Argentina over the country’s expropriation of Repsol’s stake in Argentinean explorer YPF (YPF -5%), Reuters reports. Mexico’s Pemex, which holds 9.2% of Repsol, is said to be acting as an intermediary in negotiations with the hope of gaining a stake in Argentina's Vaca Muerta shale field. (earlier)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:29 AM
  • ZNGA

    Andy Tian, head of Zynga's (ZNGA -6.1%) Chinese studio, is leaving the company at month's end....

    Andy Tian, head of Zynga's (ZNGA -6.1%) Chinese studio, is leaving the company at month's end. Tian, a former Electronic Arts exec, was responsible for developing international mobile titles such as Ayakashi: Ghost Guild and War of the Fallen. He's the latest in a very long line of Zynga execs to depart over the last 12 months. Shares are off sharply, but that could have more to do with a general selloff in risk assets.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:28 AM | 2 Comments
  • WLT

    Walter Energy (WLT -12.2%) hits new decade lows, weighed down in the past week by its decision...

    Walter Energy (WLT -12.2%) hits new decade lows, weighed down in the past week by its decision not to proceed with its proposed refinancing, S&P's move to place all ratings on WLT to Credit Watch with negative implications, and the weakening broader market.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:19 AM | 16 Comments
  • AMD

    An upgrade to Outperform from FBR's Christopher Rolland allows AMD (AMD +0.5%) to rise in the...

    An upgrade to Outperform from FBR's Christopher Rolland allows AMD (AMD +0.5%) to rise in the face of an equity selloff. Rolland is upbeat about AMD's SeaMicro microserver platform unit after talking with engineers/CTO at last week's GigaOm Structure conference, even as he grants AppliedMicro's (AMCC -3.3%) X-Gene chips have a mindshare edge in the server CPU space. He also thinks AMD's Xbox One/PS4 design wins can yield $900M/year in revenue. "We applaud AMD's decision to diversify away from the traditional PC market and toward semi-custom ICs, embedded processors ... and microserver systems." Jim Cramer predicted last Thursday AMD would catch upgrades. (Barron's on SeaMicro)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:11 AM
  • EQNR

    Statoil (STO -3.5%) says it has found an additional 3.8M-4.4M barrels of recoverable oil at its...

    Statoil (STO -3.5%) says it has found an additional 3.8M-4.4M barrels of recoverable oil at its Volve field in the North Sea, but an appraisal well drilled at the earlier Falk discovery came up dry. Also, Reuters reports STO saw its gas output reduced by ~8M cubic meters per day over the weekend due to unplanned outages.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:56 AM
  • SPPI

    Shares of Spectrum Pharmaceuticals (SPPI -5.9%) are taking a beating this morning. Credit...

    Shares of Spectrum Pharmaceuticals (SPPI -5.9%) are taking a beating this morning. Credit Suisse's Jason Kantor is cautious on the stock in general and on Fusilev specifically, noting that "Q2 sales and H2 run rate are likely to disappoint." SPPI downgraded to Underperform from Neutral.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:50 AM | 1 Comment
  • GOLD

    Newcrest Mining's decision to write down the value of its mines by $5B-$6B is more than the...

    Newcrest Mining's decision to write down the value of its mines by $5B-$6B is more than the biggest one-time charge in gold mining history; Jefferies believes Barrick Gold (ABX -5%), Newmont Mining (NEM -3.4%), Gold Fields (GFI -3%) and Goldcorp (GG -4.1%) are among other top producers facing big writedowns. “It is not too late to be short these names on this writedown theme," the firm's Jake Greenberg says. (also)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:45 AM | 6 Comments
  • FSLR

    First Solar (NASDAQ:FSLR) +1.3% after JPMorgan starts coverage with an Overweight and $64 PT,...

    First Solar (NASDAQ:FSLR) +1.3% after JPMorgan starts coverage with an Overweight and $64 PT, and Maxim upgrades shares to Hold. JPM's coverage launch comes even though FSLR was the only stock to make JPM's list of stocks to avoid in 2013, back in December. Analyst Paul Coster, who has covered everything from TiVo to chip stocks, expects FSLR to beat consensus 2014 EPS estimates, and calls the company the best-positioned solar pure play. Maxim was bearish on FSLR for much of its run-up, and resumed coverage at Sell earlier this month.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:29 AM

  • Market preview: The great global selloff continues after some sort of respite on Friday, with...

    Market preview: The great global selloff continues after some sort of respite on Friday, with the meltdown in China rippling across the globe to hit a variety of asset classes. PBOC tightening liquidity just as the Fed says it's going to ease off the money printing is combining to produce a market situation that's not very pretty at all. The S&P mini is -0.7%, while 10-year Treasury yields hit 2-year highs and copper slides 2.3%. Later: Dallas Fed Manufacturing Outlook, Fed's Fisher
     
     
     
     
    | 9:20 AM
  • OCZ

    OCZ (NASDAQ:OCZ) +10.2% and Fusion-io (NYSE:FIO) +2.2% following news Western Digital is...

    OCZ (NASDAQ:OCZ) +10.2% and Fusion-io (NYSE:FIO) +2.2% following news Western Digital is acquiring enterprise solid-state drive vendor sTec at a 91% premium to Friday's close. Both OCZ and Fusion-io have often been the subjects of buyout speculation; a couple of OCZ rumors have involved Western Digital archrival Seagate. Fusion-io has more of an enterprise focus than OCZ, but new CEO Shane Robison recently declared the company isn't for sale.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:19 AM
  • STEC

    Premarket gainers: STEC +89%. VHS +67%. ISIS +11%. OCZ +10%. THC +5%. SNTA +5%.Losers: SZYM...

    Premarket gainers: STEC +89%. VHS +67%. ISIS +11%. OCZ +10%. THC +5%. SNTA +5%.
    Losers: SZYM -12%. CTIC -11%. KNDI -8%. ALU -6%. 
     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM
  • BBEPQ

    BreitBurn Energy Partners (BBEP) agrees to acquire Whiting Petroleum's (NYSE:WLL) interests in...

    BreitBurn Energy Partners (BBEP) agrees to acquire Whiting Petroleum's (NYSE:WLL) interests in the Postle and North East Hardesty oilfields, along with associated midstream assets, in the Oklahoma panhandle for ~$860M. The acquired properties add ~7,400 boe/day (87% oil, 11% nat gas liquids) net production as of April 2013. BBEP +2.4%, WLL +0.3% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:06 AM
  • UAMY

    United States Antimony (NYSEMKT:UAMY) +69.4% premarket after reporting it has a lease on the San...

    United States Antimony (NYSEMKT:UAMY) +69.4% premarket after reporting it has a lease on the San Jose Antimony Mines (Wadley) in San Luis Potosi, Mexico. UAMY will lease the mine for one year with renewal rights.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:56 AM
  • SKS

    Saks (NYSE:SKS) is a serious target of Hudson's Bay, according to Women's Wear Daily. Talks are...

    Saks (NYSE:SKS) is a serious target of Hudson's Bay, according to Women's Wear Daily. Talks are ongoing as the Canadian firm reviews how Saks might fit into its North American plans. SKS +3.4% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:44 AM

  • It's a painful day across the board for Southeast Asian markets as foreign outflows continue to...

    It's a painful day across the board for Southeast Asian markets as foreign outflows continue to hit shares amid worries about China and an impending Fed taper. Philippine (EPHE), Thai (THD), Indonesian (IDX, EIDO), and Malysian (EWM) shares fall 3.41%, 2.6%, 1.9%, and 1% respectively as foreign investors are net sellers for the month in all four countries, according to Reuters. The Straits Times (EWS, EWSS) is down 1.6% and Vietnamese shares (VNM) slide 1.8%.

Veterans of central bank-speak know the drill - 1) act tough 2) act tough some more 3) cave. It's worth noting benchmark money market rates tumbled for a 2nd consecutive day, the overnight repo rate off 196 bps to 6.47% (it had been near 13% two sessions ago).
